VincentM - (09:35): Hello, I am coming to ask : I know little about programming but I want to develop something that would look like a wiki with added functionality  
VM joined #xwiki at 09:36  
VM - (09:36): Hello, I am coming to ask : I know little about programming but I want to develop something that would look like a wiki with added functionality.  
VM - (09:36): Is the Xwiki for me?  
Guest82871 left at 09:36 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds

mflorea joined #xwiki at 10:40  
vmandrilly joined #xwiki at 11:33  
vmandrilly - (11:34): Hello, sorry I needed some time to know how to use IRC, and the irc chat on the websites didnt seem to work well...  
cjdelisle` - (11:35): Do you have a question?  
vmandrilly - (11:35): Anyway, I want to make a collaborative tool for organizations and most specifically political parties that would meet the needs of making online elections.  
vmandrilly - (11:35): Looks like a wiki is best solution  
vmandrilly - (11:36): but then I wonder which wiki is best for my needs, knowing that I'll need to developp easily new tools  
cjdelisle` - (11:37): If you want extensibility then XWiki is what you want.  
vmandrilly - (11:38): Ok, now, I know almost nothing about programming myself, where should I start?  
cjdelisle` - (11:38): !search xwiki scripting  
vmandrilly - (11:38): Thanks very much  
cjdelisle` - (11:38): hmm. Not the page I was looking for...  
cjdelisle` - (11:38): http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Scripting  
vmassol - (11:48): For a moment I thought someone had taken my identity ;)  
vmassol - (11:48): (vincentM is also my name, as is VM ;))  
vmandrilly - (11:48): Ah ah  
vmandrilly - (11:48): coincidence  
vmandrilly - (11:49): OK, I belive I have found exaclty what I need with this Xwiki  
vmassol - (11:49): cool  
vmassol - (11:49): search scripting  
vmassol - (11:49): !search scripting  
vmandrilly - (11:49): yes yes, thanks  
vmassol - (11:49): (hmm not very accurate)  
vmassol - (11:50): (was just testing)  
vmassol - (11:50): oh caleb alreayd did this above, didn't see it  
vmandrilly - (11:52): Is this IRC channel for help or something else too?  
vmandrilly - (11:54): I guess it's just for Xwiki development, sorry to bother everyone.  
cjdelisle` - (11:55): nah, it's for questions and answers too.  
vmandrilly - (11:55): Ok. By the way I am from France and live in China, if you have any language related question, you can ask me.  
cjdelisle` - (11:59): How's the weather?  
vmandrilly - (11:59): New question : I see diffrent computer "languages" in "scripting", which one should I learn?  
cjdelisle` - (12:00): Velocity is a good start because it does not need to have programming rights in order to run.  
vmandrilly - (12:00): It's night here cjdeliste. South China pretty warm, feel hot with my T-shirt.  
cjdelisle` - (12:01): It's below freezing here, no snow yet though.  
vmandrilly - (12:01): Sorry, should I say Caleb maybe?  
sburjan` - (12:02): vmassol: ps : I won's to a DOS taking the ircbot nickname :)  
sburjan` - (12:02): \*won't  
vmandrilly - (12:08): Does usine velocity requires to install and host on my own computer?  
vmandrilly - (12:09): \*using  
cjdelisle` - (12:09): Nope. All you need is XWiki and you write the code into the wiki page.  
vmandrilly - (12:10): Ok. Thanks again.  
vmandrilly - (12:13): Looks like that mean that anyone using the wiki can contribute to change the script and therefore change the programm running on the page. No security issue about modifing other part of the website?  
cjdelisle` - (12:14): The script can only do things to the site which either the script's author or the viewer are allowed to do.  
vmandrilly - (12:16): When you say "you write the code into the wiki page" you mean I write it like I'd edit a page using my browser?  
vmandrilly - (12:16): that is to say, anyone could edit the source (if alowed)  
vmandrilly - (12:17): and change the velocity script  
cjdelisle` - (12:17): yes and yes.  
cjdelisle` - (12:18): ^but if your script does something which only you are allowed to do then they edit it, it will stop working because they become the author.  
vmandrilly - (12:18): ok ok, I think I got it.  
vmandrilly - (12:19): I think I'll have long nights next year...  
cjdelisle` - (12:20): If you know some java then velocity is really easy.  
cjdelisle` - (12:20): It's java with fewer keywords and more security.  
vmandrilly - (12:22): So should I start by learning java?  
vmandrilly - (12:30): Maybe http://velocity.apache.org/engine/devel/user-guide.html is the best way to learn.  
vmassol - (12:31): vmandrilly: where do you live in China? I've lived in HongKong in the past for 2 years  
vmandrilly - (12:34): Very close to hongkong  
vmandrilly - (12:35): I am in Dongguan  
vmandrilly - (12:35): I am on the other side of the GFW  
vmandrilly - (12:35): :P  
vmandrilly - (12:36): on the wrong side...  
vmassol - (12:36): hehe  
vmandrilly - (12:37): why your name changed color?  
vmandrilly - (12:37): I am so noob, omg  
vmassol - (12:37): no idea, must be something with your irc client  
vmandrilly - (12:37): vmassol: maybe because you talked only to me?  
vmassol - (12:38): maybe  
vmassol - (12:40): I love the hongkong food? especially the cha siu fan, or siu yok fan :)  
vmassol - (12:40): (hard to find good ones here)  
vmandrilly - (12:41): Haha, I know nothing about Cantonese language.  
vmandrilly - (12:41): Design I leave in a place where people are supposed to speak this language  
vmandrilly - (12:41): \*Depite  
vmandrilly - (12:41): \* live  
vmassol - (12:42): too bad.;.. ngo msik gong guongdongwah batgwo sik gong fatman :)  
vmassol - (12:42): ok that's about all I know :)  
vmandrilly - (12:42): hahaha  
vmassol - (12:42): I tried learning it for 2 years  
vmassol - (12:42): and I couldn't even read the newsapper  
vmandrilly - (12:43): ????????????  
vmassol - (12:44): it means: I cannot speak cantonese but I speak French  
florinciu joined #xwiki at 12:45  
vmassol - (12:45): bbiab  
jvdrean joined #xwiki at 12:51  
abusenius joined #xwiki at 12:52  
vmandrilly - (13:07): Ah bon, il faudra que je retienne cette phrase alors

sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 14:30  
sdumitriu - (14:32): vmassol: How important is XPAS-31 for 2.7?  
vmassol - (14:33): blocker IMO  
sdumitriu - (14:33): Well, it's hard to fix  
vmassol - (14:33): ah  
sdumitriu - (14:33): It would be easy if hsqldb understood date(some date property)  
sdumitriu - (14:34): Or if this issue was really fixed: http://opensource.atlassian.com/projects/hibernate/browse/HHH-592  
vmassol - (14:34): sdumitriu: how do I url encode in js? For ex I want "/" to be encoded. I tried encodeURIComponent but it doesn't seem to work  
vmassol - (14:35): http://www.javascripter.net/faq/escape.htm says it should work  
sdumitriu - (14:35): Are you sure?  
sdumitriu - (14:35): Are you sure it doesn't work?  
vmassol - (14:36): I'm using this:  
vmassol - (14:36):     <input class="button" style="font-weight:bold" type="submit" value="Add" onclick="action='../../inline/Extension/' + encodeURIComponent(this.form.name.value); this.form.submit();" />  
vmassol - (14:36): and I get the following url when using "vincent/test":  
vmassol - (14:36): http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/inline/Extension/vincent/test?parent=Extension.WebHome&template=ExtensionCode.ExtensionTemplate&name=vincent/test  
sdumitriu - (14:36): And action is?  
vmassol - (14:36): it's for form action  
sdumitriu - (14:36): Try this.form.action  
vmassol - (14:37): it works for other inputs but ok I'll try  
sdumitriu - (14:37): Try  
sdumitriu - (14:37): alert(encodeURIComponent(this.form.name.value)  
vmassol - (14:39): works  
vmassol - (14:39): (it's encoded)  
vmassol - (14:39): so it must be decoded somewhere after  
sdumitriu - (14:39): Hm, note that the browser doesn't show the exact URL, but the decoded one  
sdumitriu - (14:39): Try copy/paste the URL  
jvdrean left #xwiki at 14:40  
vmassol - (14:40): it's not encoded  
vmassol - (14:40): http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/inline/Extension/vincent/test?parent=Extension.WebHome&template=ExtensionCode.ExtensionTemplate&name=vincent/test  
sdumitriu - (14:41): Can I test this live?  
vmassol - (14:41): yep: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/edit/Main/WebHome?&editor=wiki  
vmassol - (14:41): http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/  
vmassol - (14:41): try adding an extension  
sdumitriu - (14:42): I got this:  
sdumitriu - (14:42): http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/inline/Extension/a%2Fb%2Fc?parent=Extension.WebHome&template=ExtensionCode.ExtensionTemplate&name=a%2Fb%2Fc  
vmassol - (14:42): chrome?  
vmassol - (14:42): trying in FF?  
sdumitriu - (14:42): FF  
vmassol - (14:42): s/?//  
vmassol - (14:43): ah different result  
vmassol - (14:43): I get: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/inline/Extension/vincent%2Ftest?parent=Extension.WebHome&template=ExtensionCode.ExtensionTemplate&name=vincent%2Ftest  
sdumitriu - (14:43): But our tomcat is wrongly configured, %2F triggers a security exception and it's not found  
vmassol - (14:44): it fails though but that may be some other problem  
vmassol - (14:44): yep  
vmassol - (14:44): so different behavior in chrome and FF  
vmassol - (14:48): sdumitriu: do we have a js function to clean a page name (remove spaces, transform into wiki words, etc)?  
vmassol - (14:49): I'd like to compute a clean page name and set as title what the user has entered  
vmassol - (14:49): you think that's a good approach?  
sdumitriu left at 14:49 (Ping timeout: 245 seconds  
sdumitriu joined #xwiki at 15:31  
sburjan` - (15:36): sdumitriu, vmassol : friday I found a bug in AS  
sdumitriu - (15:36): Which one?  
sburjan` - (15:36): Creating a new page and raising it to Version 3.1, the deleting it, will gat a nasty error in console  
sburjan` - (15:37): because AS still searches for that page with that specific version  
sburjan` - (15:37): re-creating page will NOT help untill you get to the specific version it was before deletion  
sburjan` - (15:38): and it is related with AS, because if I remove to include fomr Main.Dashboard from Main page, I don't get that error anymore  
sburjan` - (15:39): neither if I re-create the page to the specific version  
sdumitriu - (15:39): sburjan`: Yes, noticed that too  
sdumitriu - (15:44): vmassol: You should never use  
sdumitriu - (15:44): ?../../inline/Extension/? + docName  
sdumitriu - (15:44): This breaks short URLs  
vmandrilly - (15:48): Hello, any idea why when I search for VELOCITY on the seach box, I get many results, but no result with the word I asked.... ?  
vmandrilly - (15:48): Despite I did found a page specifically about it just some time ago.  
vmandrilly - (15:49): thanks to your links  
vmandrilly - (15:55): Should I just consider search module just not working yet on Xwiki? ('Cause I'd rather have this work for my project :p )  
vmandrilly - (15:58): Or maybe it was somehow plublicised on all pages when last search indexing was running?  
vmandrilly - (15:59): (and is now removed from these pages)  
vmandrilly - (15:59): ?  
cjdelisle` - (15:59): you're googling velocity?  
cjdelisle` - (16:00): google: "apache velocity"  
vmandrilly - (16:00): I am using http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki internal search engine  
vmandrilly - (16:01): but it doesnt seem to work normally for this search  
vmandrilly - (16:10): looks more like a specific bug that would affect only this word.  
vmandrilly - (16:10): everything else seems to work  
vmandrilly - (16:10): I guess this word in taken into account when indexing.  
vmandrilly - (16:11): when it should not be  
vmandrilly - (16:12): if there not too many wrong indexations it's probably not an important issue  
sdumitriu - (16:21): vmandrilly: velocity is present in all those pages  
sdumitriu - (16:22): It's not displayed since it's not used as a visible word, but as a marker for velocity code  
vmandrilly - (16:27): ok, my second guess was the good one : it is a work indexed that shouldn't have been indexed  
vmandrilly - (16:28): \*word  
vmandrilly - (16:31): cjdelisle: which xwiki shall I download?  
vmandrilly - (16:33): "XWiki Enterprise is the default wiki product based on the XWiki Platform" OK  
cjdelisle` - (16:33): enterprise, yes.  
florinciu1 joined #xwiki at 16:49  
florinciu left at 16:50 (Ping timeout: 265 seconds  
vmandrilly left #xwiki at 17:09  
sdumitriu - (17:33): vmassol: What's the maven plugin that creates a jar together with all the needed dependency classes copied inside it? There's the assembly plugin with the jar-with-dependencies descriptor, but it copies all classes, not only those that are really used.  
vmassol - (17:43): sdumitriu: shade plugin  
sdumitriu - (17:44): Thank  
sdumitriu - (17:44): s  
vmassol - (18:01): sdumitriu: re /../../inline yes it's bad. What's the best practice? Call the same page with a request param and if that param is set do a redirect computed in velocity?  
sdumitriu - (18:01): Yes  
vmassol - (18:01): ok will do  
sdumitriu - (18:01): This way it works without JS as well  
vmassol - (18:01): sdumitriu: do we have a js function to clean a page name (remove spaces, transform into wiki words, etc)?  
vmassol - (18:01): I'd like to compute a clean page name and set as title what the user has entered  
vmassol - (18:01): you think that's a good approach?  
vmassol - (18:01): yes  
sdumitriu - (18:02): We have such a function, but personally I don't like it  
vmassol - (18:02): err the message above was a copy paste  
sdumitriu - (18:02): We should allow all possible chars  
vmassol - (18:02): since we juste agreed not to use js  
vmassol - (18:03): so use the title as the page name?  
vmassol - (18:03): (I mean let the user enter the title and use that as pager name)  
vmassol - (18:03): s/pager/page/  
sdumitriu - (18:04): Yes  
vmassol - (18:04): ok  
sdumitriu - (18:04): Hm, we'll have problems with the escaped / and \  
sdumitriu - (18:04): But we should fix the tomcat configuration  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 18:09  
npm left at 18:16 (\*.net \*.split  
npm joined #xwiki at 18:16  
jvelo joined #xwiki at 19:07  
Arcainus - (19:39): quit  
Arcainus left at 19:39 (Quit: leaving  
Sashi joined #xwiki at 19:44  
Sashi - (19:44): boo  
jvelo - (20:17): ba  
vmassol - (20:17): jvelo: hello  
jvelo - (20:17): vmassol, hey  
vmassol - (20:18): jvelo: left some messages for you on skype re extensions wiki (no hurry, can wait for tomorrow !)  
jvelo - (20:18): OK, will read that  
jvelo - (20:19): we need to finish ASAP, I have a new extension and I don't know where to publish it now :)  
vmassol - (20:19): hehe cool  
vmassol - (20:19): I proposed a strategy  
vmassol - (20:19): which is that you run the migrator and make the migrtaed ext saved in a specific space (ExtensionImported for ex)  
vmassol - (20:20): and that we review and migrate them manually one by one in the extension space  
jvelo - (20:20): and the we move manually ?  
jvelo - (20:20): hum...  
vmassol - (20:20): so that we can work in //  
jvelo - (20:20): something I wanted to do with the migrator was to set back the original creation date  
vmassol - (20:20): you, me, sburjan`, everyone who wants to help  
jvelo - (20:20): but if we do that that's not going to work  
vmassol - (20:21): why?  
jvelo - (20:21): because the final move will out back a new creation date  
vmassol - (20:21): rename  
vmassol - (20:21): does a copy  
vmassol - (20:21): does it?  
jvelo - (20:21): yep but I think the creation date is the copy date  
jvelo - (20:21): (at least that's what I noticed from my migration copy)  
jvelo - (20:21): (since it uses the copy API too)  
vmassol - (20:23): there's a resetCreationData param  
vmassol - (20:23):     public boolean copyDocument(DocumentReference sourceDocumentReference, DocumentReference targetDocumentReference,  
vmassol - (20:23):         String wikilanguage, boolean reset, boolean force, boolean resetCreationData, XWikiContext context)  
vmassol - (20:23):         throws XWikiException  
vmassol - (20:24): let me check which one is used by rename  
vmassol - (20:24): it's false  
vmassol - (20:25): so it should be ok I think  
vmassol - (20:25): let me test in real  
vmassol - (20:27): jvelo: works fine  
vmassol - (20:27): just renamed http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Meeting+Manager+Application fyi  
vmassol - (20:27): (I added the space in the page name)  
vmassol - (20:27): s/space/spaces/  
vmassol - (20:27): the history hasn't changed  
Sashi - (20:30): this might not be the best place to discuss this but im trying to decide between two software.. this and foswiki  
vmassol - (20:31): Sashi: well we're always interested to compare ourselves with other wikis  
vmassol - (20:31): brb  
Sashi - (20:33): im not sure which one to choose/get  
vmassol - (20:42): Sashi: you could send a mail to the user list with a descirption of what you're looking for in a wiki  
vmassol - (20:42): http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/MailingLists  
vmassol - (20:43): that'll allow you to get feedback from other users who might have had the same question
